content.user_title: Create a Claude Code agent specification
content.value_statement: You need a reliable format for agent files and triggers. This skill provides templates, examples, and validation guidance for consistent agent design.
actual_capabilities: Explains required frontmatter fields and valid formats for agent files.
Provides structured templates for system prompts and responsibilities.
Shows triggering examples with context and commentary blocks.
Offers complete agent examples for review, testing, and documentation roles.
Includes a bash validator script specification for agent files.
limitations: Does not generate agent files automatically without user prompts.
Does not execute validation scripts or modify files by itself.
Does not include project specific rules unless provided by the user.
Does not replace Claude Code runtime behavior or tools.

use_cases.title: Define a new agent
use_cases.description: Create a complete agent file with correct triggers and system prompt structure.

use_cases.title: Standardize agent patterns
use_cases.description: Align multiple agents with consistent frontmatter and output format guidance.

use_cases.title: Write onboarding docs
use_cases.description: Explain agent structure and examples for internal plugin documentation.

prompt_templates.title: New agent brief
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an agent definition for a code review assistant. Include name rules, trigger examples, and a system prompt outline.

prompt_templates.title: Triggering examples
prompt_templates.prompt: Write three triggering examples for a test generator agent, including context, user text, assistant response, and commentary.

prompt_templates.title: System prompt design
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft a system prompt for a documentation agent with responsibilities, process steps, quality standards, and output format.

prompt_templates.title: Validation checklist
prompt_templates.prompt: List validation checks for an agent file, including frontmatter fields, name rules, and minimum system prompt length.

output_examples.input: I need an agent that reviews code for security and best practices.
output: Agent name suggestion and naming rules
Triggering description with two usage examples
System prompt with responsibilities, process, and output format

best_practices: Use clear triggering conditions with multiple examples.
Keep system prompts structured with responsibilities and steps.
Limit tools to the minimum needed for the agent.
anti_patterns: Using vague agent names like helper or assistant.
Skipping example blocks in the description field.
Leaving output format undefined in the system prompt.

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude Code agents?
faq.answer: Yes. The formats and examples align with Claude Code plugin agent files.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides guidance and templates but does not create files or run validation.

faq.question: Can it integrate with existing plugins?
faq.answer: Yes. You can apply the guidance to any plugin that uses agent markdown files.

faq.question: Does it handle sensitive data?
faq.answer: No. It provides documentation and examples without processing user data.

faq.question: What if my agent does not trigger?
faq.answer: Improve the description and add clear examples with commentary blocks.

faq.question: How is it different from generic prompt tips?
faq.answer: It focuses on agent file structure, triggers, and system prompt patterns.
